thread.title: If Manchester United reach the Europa League final, they'll only get 10,000 tickets
thread.title_full: If Manchester United reach the Europa League final, they'll only get 10,000 tickets

author: Arash Hekmat
title: If Manchester United reach the Europa League final, they'll only get 10,000 tickets
text:
Sport If Manchester United reach the Europa League final, they'll only get 10,000 tickets The Red Devils are the favourites to go on and win the competition after reaching the round of 16 Share Only 10,000 Manchester United fans will be able to get tickets to the Europa League final if the Red Devils each that stage (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Is football ultimately a game for the fans? It depends who you ask. 
But it sounds like UEFA might be firmly in the 'no' camp after it was revealed that only 10,000 Manchester United fans will be able to go to Sweden for the Europa League final if they get that far. 
That's the paltry ticket allocation being give to each of the two clubs to contest the final, which will be held at Stockholm's 48,000 seater Friends Arena on May 24th. Zatan Ibrahimovic is familiar with the stadium, it's where he scored four goals against England including an amazing overhead kick (Photo: PA) Read More What channel is Manchester United vs FC Rostov on? All you need to know ahead of Europa League clash 
A further 17,000 tickets will be put on sale to fans and members of the general public, meaning the remaining 11,000 seats will be set aside for corporate tickets. 
International ticket sales are open from this Friday (March 17th) until March 28th, meaning many fans will purchase tickets well before knowing if their club is actually going to reach that stage of the competition. 
Each buyer can purchase up to four tickets, with applicants to learn on April 7th if they have been successful or not in acquiring a ticket. Rostov train at Old Trafford ahead of their second-leg tie on Friday (Photo: REUTERS) United have an away goals advantage after the first leg ended 1-1 (Photo: REUTERS) Read More When is the Europa League quarter-final draw? Manchester United hope to be in the hat 
And who precisely takes up the 11,000 corporate seats? According to UEFA, it's a mixture of "local organising committee, UEFA and national associations, commericla partners and broadcasters". 
Tickets will range in price from €45 (£39) at the lower end to €150 (£131) for the best seats in the house. 
Before fans can start thinking of the final, United have the small matter of the second leg of their Round of 16 tie with FC Rostov on Thursday night. 
Jose Mourinho's side go into the tie at Old Trafford with an away goals advantage, after the first leg finished 1-1. poll loading Will Manchester United reach the Europa League final? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
